projects.context:
PROJECT CONTEXT:
Project: Marketing Campaign Q1 2025
Lead: Sarah Miller (Project Lead, 10 years experience in digital marketing)

OVERVIEW:
This is a comprehensive Q1 marketing campaign focused on increasing brand awareness by 30% and generating 500+ qualified leads. The campaign will run across multiple digital channels including social media, content marketing, paid ads, and email marketing.

KEY OBJECTIVES:
- Launch social media campaign by January 15th
- Create 20 pieces of high-quality blog posts and video content
- Achieve 30% increase in brand awareness metrics
- Generate 500+ qualified marketing leads
- Stay within $250K budget allocation

TEAM MEMBERS:
- Sarah Miller: Project Lead and campaign strategist
- John Davis: Content Strategist responsible for all written and video content
- Emily Kim: Design Lead managing all visual assets and brand consistency
- Michael Rodriguez: Analytics lead tracking performance and ROI

KEY DOCUMENTS (you can fetch these URLs to read their contents):
1. Apps Espresso Weekly: https://www.notion.so/browserinc/Apps-Espresso-Weekly-29961250367680199b5cc2f780ffd176
   Weekly tracking document for project and task progress for the Apps work stream

2. Linear Board - Apps Pod: https://linear.app/the-browser-company/team/APS/active
   Linear board to keep track of task progress for the Apps pod

3. Apps Espresso Planning: https://www.notion.so/browserinc/Apps-Espresso-Planning-2846125036768032aee2dbf910448d83
   Doc outlining Dia's Apps Espresso plan to make meetings best-in-class via Google Meet integrations and proactive suggestions, with goals, metrics, teams, risks, and dependencies.

4. Apps Espresso Kickoff: https://www.notion.so/browserinc/Apps-Espresso-Kickoff-28c61250367680f0b859e167f1192eb6
   Kickoff doc outlining Dia's Apps Espresso milestone to make meetings and proactive suggestions best‑in‑class, with teams, goals, success metrics, and initial projects.

5. Espresso Product Strategy: https://www.notion.so/browserinc/Espresso-Product-Strategy-Context-284612503676800c8c6cf58013f2665b
   Product strategy document outlining Dia's Espresso milestone P0/P1 goals across Browser, Chat, Apps, and Enterprise to drive toward one million weekly active users, plus team discussions and open questions on prioritization, metrics, and differentiation.

CURRENT STATUS:
Project is in planning phase. Team has completed strategy and is now building out content calendar and creative assets. Campaign launches January 15th.

projects.name: Product Redesign Initiative
projects.shortDescription: Complete UX/UI overhaul of flagship product to improve user experience and reduce onboarding time.

lead.name: Alex Chen
lead.bio: Alex is a senior product manager with 8 years of experience in SaaS products. Previously led product at two successful startups and has a track record of improving user engagement by 40%+ through thoughtful redesigns.

projects.overview: This initiative aims to completely redesign our flagship product's user interface and experience. The goal is to reduce time-to-value for new users, improve daily active usage, and modernize the visual design to match current industry standards.
goals: Achieve 4.5+ star rating in app stores
Complete redesign by end of Q2

documents.name: User Research Findings.pdf
documents.summary: Research report from 50+ user interviews identifying key pain points: complex navigation, unclear feature discovery, and slow task completion times.

documents.name: Design System.figma
documents.summary: Comprehensive design system with new components, color palette, typography, and interaction patterns. Includes light and dark mode support.

documents.name: Technical Architecture.pdf
documents.summary: Technical plan for implementing the redesign including component migration strategy, API changes, and rollout plan with feature flags.

documents.name: Success Metrics Dashboard.xlsx
documents.summary: Tracking dashboard for key metrics including onboarding completion rate, time-to-first-value, daily active users, and feature adoption rates.

projects.context:
PROJECT CONTEXT:
Project: Product Redesign Initiative
Lead: Alex Chen (Product Manager, 8 years experience in SaaS)

OVERVIEW:
This is a comprehensive redesign of our flagship product aimed at dramatically improving user experience and engagement. Current product has usability issues that are causing high churn and low feature adoption. The redesign will modernize the UI, streamline workflows, and reduce complexity.

KEY OBJECTIVES:
- Reduce new user onboarding time from 45 minutes to 15 minutes
- Increase daily active users (DAU) by 25%
- Achieve 4.5+ star rating in app stores (currently 3.8)
- Complete full rollout by end of Q2 2025
- Launch with zero critical bugs

TEAM MEMBERS:
- Alex Chen: Product Manager defining requirements and roadmap
- Lisa Park: UX Designer leading user flows and information architecture
- David Kumar: UI Designer creating visual design and design system
- Rachel Thompson: User Researcher conducting studies and usability testing
- Tom Zhang: Engineering Lead managing technical implementation

KEY DOCUMENTS:
1. User Research Findings (doc5): 50+ interviews revealed major pain points - users struggle with navigation (68% report confusion), feature discovery is poor (users only find 30% of available features), and tasks take 2-3x longer than competitors. Key insight: users want simpler workflows with better guidance.

2. Design System (doc6): New modern design with cleaner aesthetics. Reduced color palette to 3 primary colors (purple, white, gray). Larger touch targets, improved contrast ratios for accessibility. Consistent spacing system. All components built in Figma with dark mode support.

3. Technical Architecture (doc7): Phased rollout approach using feature flags. Backend API will remain mostly unchanged. Frontend rebuild using React 18 with improved performance. Component library migration will happen module-by-module to reduce risk. Target: 50% performance improvement in page load times.

4. Success Metrics (doc8): Tracking onboarding completion (target: 85%), time-to-first-value (target: <15min), DAU (target: 25% increase), feature adoption (target: users using 50% of features), NPS score (target: 40+).

CURRENT STATUS:
Design phase 80% complete. User testing of prototypes showing positive results (15% faster task completion). Engineering team starting implementation next week. Expected beta launch in March 2025.
